Important Locations.name: Important Locations
Important Locations.text:
Important Locations

Many interesting places exists in the kingdom of Aglarion. The main roads are patrolled and maintained by the King's Army, especially near Onadbyr.

Associated scene. @UUID[Scene.azK3Ii4jZUlAula6]{Kingdom of Aglarion}.

  • This is a modular map, with invisible tiles that you can reveal to your players when they discover a location. (For more detail, see @UUID[JournalEntry.Fjav9OdNyLkXImZ1.JournalEntryPage.4QOYoGvPjs8IFRPK]{Modular Maps})

  • We suggest that you also roll daily on the weather table on page 109 of the Dungeon Master's Guide, just to give flavor for the voyage, and so that the party will feel the difference when the curse has set.

There are different types of locations in the Kingdom of Aglarion. Like all major towns and geographical landmarks, some are public and widely known, while some are connected to specific encounters that only happen if one visits the location. Yet others are secret and hidden until characters learn of them and the paths that lead there. However, almost all locations have a significant role in Chapter 4 of the adventure after the Midnight Curse has struck the realm.

The following summary describes the pre-curse conditions of each location in case the characters choose to travel the Kingdom before the events in Cursed Coronation (chapter 2) unfold.

If the party decides to explore the realm, activate the @UUID[Scene.azK3Ii4jZUlAula6]{Kingdom of Aglarion} scene, and use this journal as a reference.

Note. This journal, as well as all the journals in the "Kingdom of Aglarion" and "Onadbyr" folders, are set to be observable by the players, but they can't read something their character should not know.
For more details, and to see how it all works, see @UUID[JournalEntry.Fjav9OdNyLkXImZ1.JournalEntryPage.LCIiWRU7V5Zxo4Vn]{Player access}

Ethereal Cloister.name: Ethereal Cloister
Ethereal Cloister.text:
The remnants of a sunken temple of death that once stood on a rock pillar rising from the sea can be seen through the clear sea water from above. The location was a holy site where only the clergy of the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.RvZvrek5H1zHmg1M#death]{Inevitable} was allowed to enter. The monastery stood on the border of the Ethereal Plane that was so thin that those who walked the halls of the cloister could hear the voices of the dead. Those clerics who spent much time at the site could even converse with the souls of the deceased.

Unfortunately, Morgawr, the kraken necromancer, destroyed the rock pillar, and its undead apprentices sometimes visit the site to extort information from the dead.

Willow Creek.name: Willow Creek
Willow Creek.text:
Willow Creek is a small settlement of farmers and woodcutters who make a decent living by selling their produce mainly in Onadbyr. @UUID[Actor.F3L7lHZiumpKi8Ue]{Rowan}, a reserved and resourceful ranger, is the head of the village council. This village also serves as the staging ground for any Royal Hunt into the King’s Forest. The majority of the fields between the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#kings-forest]{King’s Forest} and the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#talanar-hills]{Talanar Hills} are owned by the townsfolk of Willow Creek.

Grorrarr's Lair.name: Grorrarr's Lair
Grorrarr's Lair.text:
Inside the King’s Forest, nesting in a cave by an ancient tree, lives @UUID[Actor.BDKjDWRqaVndUevS]{Grorrarr} the owlbear druid, with its two younglings. Grorrarr keeps to the deepest parts of the woods and is content with raising its cubs in peace. However, it does not welcome visitors and has already gotten into multiple disagreements with the lumberjacks of @UUID[.il78IgA5IV47nCTL]{Willow Creek} (location 4.) when they had intruded on her territory.

Ronul's End.name: Ronul's End
Ronul's End.text:
The pearl fishing village of Ronul’s End is a relatively new settlement, only a century old, founded by Almeiro Ronul - famed pirate and founder of the Ronul family. The town is inhabited by a mix of merfolk, lizardfolk, and other settlers and is a tidy and profitable little village. @UUID[Actor.EvoYI5FyshrB09T7]{Lord Dyzag Ronul}, the elder Ronul baron, manages the town from the old Ronul Villa built from and around Almeiro Ronul’s beached flagship, the Boundless Pearl. His closest ally and friend, @UUID[Actor.432wjFoavsvZPtdT]{“Salty Eel” Sykes} is a seasoned veteran who is the loyal right-hand of the aging lord.

Abandoned Farm.text:
This farmhouse in the northern reaches of the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#talanar-hills]{Talanar Hills} has been abandoned for generations. An active well lies next to its crumbling walls.

Monastery of Past Lives.name: Monastery of Past Lives
Monastery of Past Lives.text:
In a forested area, south of the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#talanar-hills]{Talanar Hills}, sits a small lake with an island in its center. On the island stands the Monastery of Past Lives, founded by the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.y73fauf7VCxVrzTe#house-karramosa]{Karramosa} family and built on top of a mine that contains a high amount of gemstones. The gems are cut and sold in Onadbyr.

The mine contain an earth elemental node that contains a high amount of gemstones.

The deep node is inhabited by @UUID[Actor.LRo8YAAMZfB9Mumw]{Luriana Karramosa}, who had transformed into a vicious large xorn that feeds on the gemstones.

The monks of the monastery, secretly in the employ of the noble family, sometimes descend to the node and steal some of the constantly resurfacing stones in stealth.

For more informations, see:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.y73fauf7VCxVrzTe#house-karramosa]{House Karramosa} (Noble house of the kingdom)

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.5lrheTIyFtYevxdO]{Monastery of Past Lives} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 10, chapter 4)

Cache of Almeiro Ronul.name: Cache of Almeiro Ronul
Cache of Almeiro Ronul.text:
Some speculate that the fabled Treasures of Almeiro Ronul are hidden in these hills, however these are merely rumors among the countless tales that @UUID[Actor.EvoYI5FyshrB09T7]{Lord Dyzag} spreads about the cache to disseminate misinformation.

Almerio Ronul’s effectively buried his pirate treasure in the northeastern section of the Talanar Hills.

Its location is only known to Almerio’s descendant, Lord Dyzag Ronul, who guards this secret with his life.

This location is can only be found by exploring, since nobody knows of it's existence.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.eu7MI8PjmA0BRRPk]{Cache of Almeiro Ronul} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 11, chapter 4)

Abandoned Lodge.name: Abandoned Lodge
Abandoned Lodge.text:
In a hidden valley, the northern area also houses the secret hideout of the Heroes of Virtue, a group of duplicitous adventurers.

The gang’s members are rarely found in the lodge, which is maintained by their hirelings.

These hired thugs have no knowledge of the accumulated treasures that are stored in the secret cellar of the building that is trapped in multiple ways to keep out intruders.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.9ER0DXroyPbnsA8a]{Abandoned Lodge} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 12, chapter 4)

Royal Hunting Lodge.name: Royal Hunting Lodge
Royal Hunting Lodge.text:
This lodge and the surrounding buildings were built during the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.xlCqGIMNmyhjubvz#the-ebrin-dynasty-(year-215–354)]{Ebrin dynasty} over the base of a villa originally used by the leadership of the Order of the Eternal Light. Some say that the most important decisions were made here at the time, in the seclusion of the forest.

The lodge is mostly unused during the majority of the year, with only a couple of soldiers, hunters, and a minimal staff stationed here on a permanent basis. However, in case the monarch decides to go on a hunt, the lodge is quickly filled up by the famous and wealthy.

Unknown to most but the oldest loremasters, under the basement and accessible through the well is a crypt where the Order’s leaders entombed a group of clerics who doubted the legitimacy of theocratic rule centuries ago.

Cursed kingdom description:

@UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.7bVa4ZuwuhrY07Iw]{Royal Hunting Lodge} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 13, chapter 4)

The Green Road.name: The Green Road
The Green Road.text:
The brick road between the @UUID[.bNqgbk8IFZbYT3H1]{crossroads} (location 19) and @UUID[.Zmm7iQOfxSEvzLuK]{Nangrath} (location 15) cuts through the woods and is not as well tended as the King’s Road to the south. Two deep grooves mark the passage of countless wagons laden with ore that have passed through the wooded area. The forest around the road is teeming with wildlife.

Cursed kingdom description:

Post curse, this location becomes the Thick of the Woods.

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.5JDfaFo7TjVuAz5K]{Thick of the Woods} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 14, chapter 4)

Nangrath.name: Nangrath
Nangrath.text:
The town of Nangrath, once the focal point of the war effort against the Vordani confederacy of tribes, is now a tiny, poor, backwater village inhabited mainly by dwarves and humans. Although most of the inhabitants have an ancestor who fought or supported the war effort, most of the populace consists of weathered peasants who make a living from farming.

As trade to the north and mining activities dwindled, the village got poorer and poorer, with some inhabitants deciding to move to the south to other towns such as @UUID[.il78IgA5IV47nCTL]{Willow Creek} (location 4) or @UUID[.UkUFginTGotvRy13]{Harveston} (location 52). The buildings are sturdy and well constructed, but many are empty and unused. A large part of the old stone wall around the village was taken apart and used as a resource for repairing Nangrath Bastion, rising at the center of the circular village. The town is overseen by @UUID[Actor.OcCGSFLmqO3HdukJ]{Lord Arenbar Nangrath}, the elderly dwarf patron who still remembers the days of the war.

He lives in Nangrath Bastion, which is essentially a thick-walled tower surrounded by a stone wall, guarded by the Lord’s commander, personal guard, and confidante, @UUID[Actor.Sg3tDgwKhw30Cob8]{captain Ick Forge-n-hammer}. The lord’s elder son, Yarik manages the day-to-day activities of the village, and most townsfolk hold him in high regard as a just and honest person. His younger son, Odryk, lives in Onadbyr and manages the @UUID[JournalEntry.unUwzkbA5fQamYlH.JournalEntryPage.zwizf19zLyoFoxlV]{family villa} (Onadbyr location 28) in the capital. The town has a small magic shop operated by @UUID[Actor.QMQRYXctq0IY7m5C]{Thermerson the Wise}, a mage and archeologist, who travels these areas in search of magic trinkets, mainly found in locations of known battles in the north.

For more informations, see:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.y73fauf7VCxVrzTe#house-nangrath]{House Nangrath} (Noble house of the kingdom)

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.phJtIOG5j3scHZ5q]{Nangrath} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 15, chapter 4)

  • @UUID[Scene.VvyJXg4yWRTJnpgs]{Nangrath (chapter 4)} (Map, chapter 4)

Fort Stormbreaker.name: Fort Stormbreaker
Fort Stormbreaker.text:
The ruins of Fort Stormbreaker dominate the landscape. Dwarves and humans built the fort on top of ancient ruins to serve against the attacks of the Vordani barbarians.

As part of the truce with @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.YBau4aklzXO4754W#vordan]{Vordan}, the two sides agreed to dismantle the forts, and two Vordani families were settled next to its ruins as part of this agreement.

The Vordanis don’t mingle or mix with the people of Aglarion and are ready to signal Vordan if the ruins of the fort are ever disturbed or armies were to march on Vordan from Aglarion.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.qHx1q2CV6CgjEXhS]{Fort Stormbreaker} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 16, chapter 4)

Fort Blackbell.name: Fort Blackbell
Fort Blackbell.text:
Fort Blackbell was the main fortress guarding the road to the north. As long as memory serves, there was a fortification in this location. The fort housed a magical bell that could be heard even as far as the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#talanar-hills]{Talanar Hills}. Since the treaty with the Vordani tribes, Aglarion has removed the troops from this location and is content with just Nangrath soldiers patrolling the area from time to time.

The ancient fort is uninhabited and stands in ruins.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.1fC34Cjnot5CFGgB]{Fort Blackbell} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 17, chapter 4)

Darkstone.name: Darkstone
Darkstone.text:
The cave opening leading to the Dark Below is well hidden among the many depleted mining sites in the area. However, deep in the lower caverns of Darkstone are the ramshackle remains of an old duergar trading post built over an ancient onyx mine.

Miners collapsed the entrance to the mines centuries ago due to otherworldly and deadly influences at the heart of the deeper mines.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.j9Ke3n3mOdYTVSrh]{Darkstone} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 18, chapter 4)

  • @UUID[Scene.8G9l7lbsw9245uMa]{Darkstone} (Map, chapter 4)

During the reign of the Lich-Knight:

  • @UUID[Scene.UsnXIsRcYBSL1vN1]{Darkstone Mines} (Map, chapter 6)

King's Road (Crossroads).name: King's Road (Crossroads)
King's Road (Crossroads).text:
The King’s Road is a well-maintained red brick road overseen by the engineers of the Royal Army. The crossroads to @UUID[.Zmm7iQOfxSEvzLuK]{Nangrath} (location 15) and @UUID[.s7D21pYFuSn5WxFU]{Gorso} (location 20) also has a signpost with a multitude of planks showing the different settlements, their directions, and distances.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.IRsNk8OkZQov0sVR]{King's Road (Crossroads)} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 19, chapter 4)

Gorso.name: Gorso
Gorso.text:
The village of Gorso is ruled by a noble family, the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.y73fauf7VCxVrzTe#house-gorso]{Gorsos}, whose members are entropist fanatics, nihilistic hedonists devoted to the force of the Elemental Chaos. They are led by the entropist warlock patron of the family, @UUID[Actor.qlWpsAVoUz3xSUYy]{Lord Ziademos Gorso}. The town is situated along the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#river-nenock]{River Nenock}, surrounded by stone walls and watchtowers, with the motte-and-bailey castle of the Gorso family in the center of the town. There used to be a bridge next to the fort, which was destroyed in a peasant uprising, so the Gorsos now operate a ferry that transports passengers and cargo across the river. Almost everyone in the town is used to the erratic and often oppressive rule of the Gorso family, accepting it as the state of the world, given that the Gorsos provide work to the majority of the populace.

Lately, rumors say that as part of his crazed quest in service of the Elemental Chaos, Lord Ziademos Gorso has been obsessed with a hunt for a unicorn to further his studies into the forces of chaos and law, employing many hunters in this endeavor. @UUID[Actor.kuvu5Tx0Al4Ttx1u]{Gianas Lor’Ghianki}, a friendly but lewd tiefling, dismissed from the College of Minstrels, runs the Flirty Nymphs brothel, catering almost exclusively to Ziademos Gorso and the members of his family.

For more informations, see:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.y73fauf7VCxVrzTe#house-gorso]{House Gorso} (Noble house of the kingdom)

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.unUwzkbA5fQamYlH.JournalEntryPage.kssgUXfqUEaHzN7W]{Gorso Villa} (Onadbyr location 39)

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.E3m4jhjTFuFxUYp7]{Gorso} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 20, chapter 4)

  • @UUID[Scene.ah1dkYvO3JrZrS8l]{Gorso (chapter 4)} (Map, chapter 4)

Trapped Woods.name: Trapped Woods
Trapped Woods.text:
This part of the forest is called @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#thornwoods]{Thornwoods}, for the thorny underbrush covering most of the forest. Most hunters or loggers also shun this area as it is unnaturally overgrown by the thorns that sometimes cover deep pits.

In reality, the gnome druid circle of the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.iiOhibBiYRG3FzPK#the-seven-thorns]{Seven Thorns} has dug several pit traps in this area, as they know that most animals don’t roam here due to the briars. The xenophobic gnome druids patrol the woods and try to keep any intruder away, preying in the form of dire wolves on the sporadic logging operations.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.ns7X1zC40TWGZQ6p]{Trapped Woods} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 21, chapter 4)

Circle of the Seven Thorns.name: Circle of the Seven Thorns
Circle of the Seven Thorns.text:
This area of the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#thornwoods]{Thornwoods} is a densely grown, thick forest that hides the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.iiOhibBiYRG3FzPK#the-seven-thorns]{Circle of the Seven Thorns}, an ancient radical gnome druid circle led by @UUID[Actor.5Lo1QSMZ1rCvhQVK]{Tonk Wildwander}. The gnome druid circle is a remnant of the Seven Flowers, who were hunted almost to extinction and have been in hiding for centuries. The neighboring peoples call this part of the woods the Vanishing Woods as they say everyone who ventures into the dense thicket is never seen again.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.pzgyCYch0xnTFQjM]{Circle of the Seven Thorns} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 22, chapter 4)

The Maze of Flowers.name: The Maze of Flowers
The Maze of Flowers.text:
Tucked between the hills under the veil of the forest is a magical maze made out of plants, which continuously grows and changes. Its walls are thorny bushes, floors covered with vines, and ceiling overgrown with thick branches. Flowers constantly blossom and wither within its confines in the span of a few minutes, as if time flows faster in this location. The mixed smell of the decaying and flowering plants nauseates any who enter. Legends say druids of old built the maze to serve as a testing ground and that only wise decisions and the knowledge of the magic of nature can help to find its center. There looms an old druid shrine to the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.RvZvrek5H1zHmg1M#nature]{Eternal Mother} containing a portal, which allows travel to the @UUID[.ddbG4HFqjejZv4GT]{stride of the elders} (location 43) in the southern section of the Arden Forest.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • The @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.m9TFXnemZCLJ26Fz]{Maze of Flowers} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 23, chapter 4)

Battlefields of Torak.name: Battlefields of Torak
Battlefields of Torak.text:
This is the location of one of the greatest battles fought between @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.YBau4aklzXO4754W#vordan]{Vordan} and Aglarion, where a complete Vordani war chariot company, the Blood Wheels, was wiped out. After the war and as part of the truce, the two kings of the opposing forces erected a huge stone slab to commemorate the event and the fallen.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.wqvbdbp8zJ66eTQM]{Battlefields of Torak} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 24, chapter 4)

The Dragon's Bones.name: The Dragon's Bones
The Dragon's Bones.text:
This is a hilly landscape that is very rarely traveled. Hidden between the hills is the skeleton of the ancient gargantuan bronze dragon Thelarmas, ally to Lord Eard Wytas “Dragonfriend” Arden.

A blind human hermit, @UUID[Actor.Ll9Jx9w7IvNNGYda]{Selvaro}, tends to the bones.

Selvaro is the youngest son of Thelarmas, in human form. He was blinded from an encounter with the oozes who took over its father’s lair.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[.BHunymR9153VIa1h]{Shrine of the Blind God} (Kingdom of Aglarion location 26)

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.wNmMFBoarJQmPRRq]{The Dragon's Bones} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 25, chapter 4)

Shrine of the Blind God.name: Shrine of the Blind God
Shrine of the Blind God.text:
The lair of Thelarmas, the ancient bronze dragon, was overrun by oozes summoned by worshippers of the Blind God, an evil deity of oozes. They transformed the lair into the Shrine of the Blind God and, in their mad search for communion with their god, transformed their own bodies into a manifestation of the Blind God itself. As a result, oozes infest the lair, and the souls of the cultists have been cursed in undeath to eternal worship as a spectral congregation. The gargantuan gelatinous cube guarding the entry to the caves burns out the eyes of anyone who enters.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.8wItkIHEfqQdN9vg]{Shrine of the Blind God} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 26, chapter 4)

  • @UUID[Scene.vVATU72RMhScgGD3]{Shrine of the Blind God} (Map, chapter 4)

Garden of Plenty.name: Garden of Plenty
Garden of Plenty.text:
The story of the creation of this magical garden has been lost to time, but local sages recall a garden where bushes grow berries of which a single one can feed a grown person for a day.

The garden is well hidden and is currently the lair of a huge brown bear, who has found the magical berries and is feeding on them, keeping all other contenders away.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.Wj7ux38ZtcJRnToj]{Garden of Plenty} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 27, chapter 4)

Clearwater Pond.name: Clearwater Pond
Clearwater Pond.text:
The waters of Clearwater Pond are pristine, its shores teeming with life.

Cursed kingdom description:

Post curse, this location becomes the Waters of Wrath.

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.TLEAXFvQcgVzU8Y5]{Waters of Wrath} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 28, chapter 4)

Smokestone Mine.name: Smokestone Mine
Smokestone Mine.text:
This mine is the source of the majority of the iron and copper ore mined in Aglarion, with rumors of several deep gold veins. Smokestone was a decent town when Aglarion was founded, but over half a millennia, people left, and it became solely a mining community overseen by the Royal Palace.

The mine is under the direction of Ilberd Serpentpike, a halfling minor noble, who manages the mine with a retinue of Royal Swords. The miners are paid well, and the ore is periodically transported to Onadbyr.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.uQ6s7AQgh9FSCvR3]{Smokestone Mine} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 29, chapter 4)

Nest of the Cackling Crows.name: Nest of the Cackling Crows
Nest of the Cackling Crows.text:
The peak of Mount Aurnmere at the edge of the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#the-mountainfall]{Mountainfall} has served as a nest of rocs for hundreds of years, from where they swoop down to the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#arden-forest]{Arden forest} to hunt caravans or river barges. The rocs are said to cackle with shrill voices when they dive upon their helpless victims, snatching up entire vehicles, and flying away with their prey towards the peak.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.CgpmXYXfzHdg9EbH]{Nest of the Cackling Crows} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 30, chapter 4)

  • @UUID[Scene.SHsoCa5wzFyhD1sV]{Nest of Cackling Crows} (Map, chapter 4)

Gate to the Darkness Within.name: Gate to the Darkness Within
Gate to the Darkness Within.text:
An immense dark gate opens into the cliffside on the top of a mountain plateau, created by the last remaining survivors and loyalists of the Dark Star during their escape after Sarath’s victory over their lord. It is a magical portal leading to the darkest section of the divine realm of the Darkness Within. None have returned from those who ever managed to cross through the gate.

A depiction of it can be seen in the @UUID[JournalEntry.sv64cqIJerN3UD4U.JournalEntryPage.tU1MTOZr9XL3Rxgq]{Hall of Art} (Royal palace area 36)

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.v1ApShGTrp4oYddF]{Gate to the Darkness Within} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 31, chapter 4)

Abulior Whitegate's Workshop.name: Abulior Whitegate's Workshop
Abulior Whitegate's Workshop.text:
Abulior Whitegate, an expelled academician from the @UUID[.yT8p89dbJi2C3wVK]{Arcane Tower} (Kingdom of Aglarion location 50), has been researching Master Arlen’s work and its connection to angelic lore in his hut at the foothills of the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#the-mountainfall]{Mountainfall}.

His original intent and area of interest were in building constructs and, in particular, the potential to create constructs with true intelligence.

The wizard was expelled for stealing an ancient dark celestial parchment annotated by Master Arlen himself that related the story of a dark deva named Samkiel, banished with the @UUID[.exxcMRUpGxr4nCYu]{Ziggurat of the New Moon} for his prophecies of doom. Abulior then settled in this area due to the legends surrounding Master Arlen’s final construct, the Colossus, for which he is searching.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.yBXf0VT09ilb3BpB]{Abulior Whitegate's Workshop} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 32, chapter 4)

Greymoss Clan Lair.name: Greymoss Clan Lair
Greymoss Clan Lair.text:
This area has long been inhabited by stone giants, the Greymoss Clan being the last of their line. In return for guarding the border against any incursions through the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#the-mountainfall]{Mountainfall}, they are accepted and allowed to dwell in this area and hunt to satisfy their needs. The clan halls are carved into the side of the mountain with enormous gateways and tall and wide corridors.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.AUXuu2n0LV1eArdO]{Greymoss Clan Lair} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 33, chapter 4)

Lodge of Wanderlust.name: Lodge of Wanderlust
Lodge of Wanderlust.text:
This lodge has stood in the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#arden-forest]{Arden Forest} since anyone can remember. It resembles a fortification made of thick and sturdy granite blocks, protecting travelers on the road for ages. It is managed by Cygnus, a human knight, who established it as an adventurer’s guild a long time ago.

@UUID[Actor.EPQTPjCicLie2644]{Cygnus} employs adventurers to find and notify the lodge of any activity that might signal any re-emergence of the Dark Star or the Darkness Within.

Cygnus is actually a couatl paladin of the Shining Light, who established the lodge over a thousand years ago.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.lDK9BZL05P9Vucvy]{Lodge of Wanderlust} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 34, chapter 4)

Overpass of the Giants.name: Overpass of the Giants
Overpass of the Giants.text:
This stone bridge was built centuries ago over the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#river-halueth]{River Halueth} and spans almost half a mile, 200 feet above the riven canyon. The bridge is not garrisoned and is not very well maintained – chipped rocks and loose stones make the traverses quite hard for wagons.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.3J5FHF7eJXLIXjsz]{Overpass of the Giants} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 35, chapter 4)

Golemcraft Cave.name: Golemcraft Cave
Golemcraft Cave.text:
The hills in the eastern section of the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#arden-forest]{Arden Forest} are dotted with small to large caves. One such larger cave hosted Master Arlen the Constructor while he built the pieces of the @UUID[Actor.vnUnjlnlHCNYHqEd]{colossus}.

The enormous cave is a stone quarry, with scaffolding and pulleys covering one of the walls and rubble at its bottom. Inoperable, rusty, and broken @UUID[Actor.tywIXctuc6DnDRfF]{daedal wrights} stand around the cave, with an active golem still guarding the location.

The spell employed in the animation of the Colossus is carved on the walls of the cave, although a large portion of it has been damaged or destroyed by floodwater from above. The section that remains explains how to stop or start the colossus, but there is no explanation of how it can be controlled.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.MXXlU6KbjoniJCeS]{Golemcraft Cave} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 36, chapter 4)

Barrow of the Colossus.name: Barrow of the Colossus
Barrow of the Colossus.text:
The forest here teems with life, and unbeknownst to all, Master Arlen’s @UUID[Actor.vnUnjlnlHCNYHqEd]{colossus} is lying here, where it buried itself under the forest at the command of the archmage. The colossal construct is inanimate, missing a crucial element of the spell to function.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.TnpKIYSQsUrMVszo]{Barrow of the Colossus} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 37, chapter 4)

Trails of the Colossus.name: Trails of the Colossus
Trails of the Colossus.text:
This encounter location only appears in Chapter 4 of the adventure when the Colossus animates.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.PYzS5zJjWyo6EcI6]{Trails of the Colossus} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 38, chapter 4)

Waylaid Pilgrims.name: Waylaid Pilgrims
Waylaid Pilgrims.text:
This encounter location only appears in Chapter 4 of the adventure after a group of pilgrims are waylaid by the Blackfur bandits.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.VpRpfISmOFt049gP]{Waylaid Pilgrims} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 39, chapter 4)

Mothfang Family Residence.name: Mothfang Family Residence
Mothfang Family Residence.text:
This mountainous area is home to the Mothfang goblin family, exiled from @UUID[.VuS3MVYbjVc34tVa]{Gonshar} (location 41) due to slights against Lord Kabok Goldtooth.

They wanted to wed their youngest daughter Zikniq to @UUID[Actor.JjsbtW2c4h6sB4LH]{Lord Kabok}, who was not too keen on the proposal. Afterward, they tried to make him agreeable by using magic but were found out by Kabok’s spies. So Kabok found it best to exile the family and forget about the whole affair.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.y3KQrB3R6140pbEt]{Mothfang Family Residence} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 40, chapter 4)

Gonshar.name: Gonshar
Gonshar.text:
Gonshar is a simple and relatively well-kept town with a decent community of friendly and hard-working folks made up of mostly goblins, hobgoblins, and bugbears who live under the rule of @UUID[Actor.JjsbtW2c4h6sB4LH]{Lord Kabok Goldtooth}, Supreme Wizard of Gonshar according to his self-awarded title, a descendant of Bilakk Goldtooth, the famed goblin warrior.

Kabok cares a lot about his village and subjects. Lord Kabok Goldtooth claims to have forged an alliance with the legendary and rarely seen gold dragon Xykot, who guards the village.

Kabok is an illusionist, and the dragon is actually an illusion sometimes conjured by Kabok to maintain his scheme and standing and as protection to ward off any hostile acts against the village. Thus, buyers don’t argue if the magic items sold here don’t work or work differently than explained.

Gonshar itself is not very self-sufficient and imports most of its food from @UUID[.s7D21pYFuSn5WxFU]{Gorso} (location 20).

For more informations, see:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.y73fauf7VCxVrzTe#house-goldtooth]{House Goldtooth} (Noble house of the kingdom)

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.unUwzkbA5fQamYlH.JournalEntryPage.Ht3E1HETSaAcGhBL]{Goldtooth Villa} (Onadbyr location 38)

  • @UUID[.yvOcvnanAHUdCSDe]{Mothfang Family Residence} (Kingdom of Aglarion location 40)

Cursed kingdom description::

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.uuvegQtBlKFJ2aJt]{Gonshar} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 41, chapter 4)

Blackfur Bandit Hideout.name: Blackfur Bandit Hideout
Blackfur Bandit Hideout.text:
A group of bandits and outlaws – the Blackfurs – claim the south of the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#arden-forest]{Arden Forest} as their own. They long for the treasures rumored to have been amassed by the dragon Xykot and take every opportunity to get more intelligence about @UUID[.VuS3MVYbjVc34tVa]{Gonshar} (location 41) and @UUID[Actor.JjsbtW2c4h6sB4LH]{Kabok}. They also prey on merchant caravans through the Arden Forest. Their numbers are slowly growing due to their success and the fact that the King and his army are far away and less interested in defending the goblinoid village. The band is led by Ishnari, a half orc and elven druid mercenary who turned to a life of crime far from the capital and hungers after the dragon’s hoard.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.GFku6HCDj66fmmYZ]{Blackfur Bandit Hideout} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 42, chapter 4)

Stride of the Elders.name: Stride of the Elders
Stride of the Elders.text:
The Seven Flowers created this magically hidden pathway in ancient times to hide and protect the planar gateway tree they planted, which is now the @UUID[.6qg87tOkBUCS5z3b]{Hagtree} (location 44).

This challenge is intended to keep out those unfamiliar with druidic spells and knowledge and is impenetrable by any other means than the ancient magic that still works here.

This location is can only be found by exploring, since nobody knows of it's existence.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.0JJNGvR9RgAhu1JU]{Stride of the Elders} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 43, chapter 4)

The Hagtree.name: The Hagtree
The Hagtree.text:
The ancient Hagtree looms on a dark patch of earth battered by the choking rain in the middle of the forest. Dark clouds roil in the skies, releasing green bolts of lightning around the gnarled form of a giant oak. The numerous eyes on its trunk and branches blink in an unsettling rhythm as menacing symbols of witchcraft dangle on its branches and sway in the wind. A small hollow between the roots of the enormous tree provides just enough space for a grown person to squeeze inside.

Originally planted by the Seven Flowers millennia ago, this ancient tree exists on four planes simultaneously – the Material Plane, the Shadowrealm, the Ethereal Plane, and the Feyrealm.

Unfortunately, after millennia of serving as a gateway between the realms, the Matrons of Malice discovered the tree. They corrupted it by bounding the souls of other hags into the tree, infusing it with malicious intent and sentience. See @UUID[JournalEntry.GQiLzQUe9UnyId97.JournalEntryPage.g5l347QHaKlmLmpW]{Traversing the Hagtree} section in chapter 4 for more details.

This location can only be discovered by exploring, everybody's having forgotten about it's very existence.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.rUqTS27S0w3Bh1ey]{Hagtree} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 44, chapter 4)

Ruins of the Water-raiser.name: Ruins of the Water-raiser
Ruins of the Water-raiser.text:
The forest overgrows the ruins of an ancient massive water-raising mechanism at the shores of the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#river-halueth]{River Halueth}. The village-sized construction was once used to transport water to the Leeward hills over aqueducts during the time of the dark angels. Today, it is the secret home of the half-elven philosopher woodworker @UUID[Actor.iBSR5NPKInPPFTNn]{Bryn Helgraz} and his family, hiding from the world and preparing for the end times.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.2Sf0JVYYo5e6E27U]{Ruins of the Water-raiser} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 45, chapter 4)

The Groaning Pillar.name: The Groaning Pillar
The Groaning Pillar.text:
Among the tall trees, hidden within the forest is a huge monolith, covered with ancient runes and long-rusted chains, with celestial hieroglyphs carved on its sides. The pillar, originally called the pillar of mercy by the fallen angels, has been dubbed the goaning pllar by later historians. It was said to be used for delivering “mercy” to those who committed crimes against the laws of the Dark Star. However, ancient vestiges of magic remain and whoever approaches the pillar has to endure the lingering punishment of the fallen angels.

Zevius, the oracle spirit naga who camps here, was expelled from its nest for being unfaithful to the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.RvZvrek5H1zHmg1M#death]{Inevitable} and its brood at the @UUID[.Qy814qhwQTMNlTsC]{Cairns of Bone} (location 47).

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.5dSWJXbKtWkgESHT]{The Groaning Pillar} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 46, chapter 4)

Cairns of Bone.name: Cairns of Bone
Cairns of Bone.text:
The north-western part of the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#leeward-hills-and-cloud-peak]{Leeward Hills} also contains ruins from the ancient age of the Dark Star. In reality, some of the hills are enormous cairns filled with the bones of the mortals who resisted and were, in turn, sacrificed by the fallen angels. The area is home to a nest of three death-worshipping spirit naga oracles, who make their home over one of the cairns. They study the bones and deduct different sacrificial rituals used in this area by the evil angels thousands of years ago. The nagas are seclusive and avoid contact with anyone who approaches them.

For more informations, see:

  • @UUID[.gXqOzc2LUn8qIdnT]{The Groaning Pillar} (Kingdom of Aglarion location 46.)

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.ZcxISMVn4YSDBUEn]{Cairns of Bone} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 47, chapter 4).

Cloud Peak.name: Cloud Peak
Cloud Peak.text:
@UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#leeward-hills-and-cloud-peak]{Cloud Peak} is a solitary mountain that is always covered in clouds. Legends claim the mountain has a direct connection to the Dark Star.

An ancient altar was used to offer blood sacrifices to the Dark Star at its peak. Sarath broke the altar as she used this location as a focal point in her ritual to power the Radiant Sphere of Annihilation and break the moon, thereby banishing the fallen angels.

Climbing the 13,000-foot mountain is a feat not many people can survive.

Post curse, this location becomes the Camp of the Red Cloak.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.D3bs6NJjOPHRgJTt]{Camp of the Redcloak} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 48, chapter 4)

The Weary Ogre.name: The Weary Ogre
The Weary Ogre.text:
The Weary Ogre is a relatively new establishment built only about two centuries ago to serve the needs of the travelers who come to visit the @UUID[.yT8p89dbJi2C3wVK]{Arcane Tower} (location 50). Ozar the Exquisite purchased the fortified inn decades ago. He is a jolly, fat, half-ogre master chef and transmuter who made it his life’s quest to serve the best food in the kingdom. Today, the Weary Ogre competes for the title of the most famous and coveted restaurant all over the continent. The dishes he serves bring in visitors from even other countries from time to time.

Adventure with Ozar:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.PldFtmYx15BRagkN.JournalEntryPage.C5tAJjrsRKymhAU8#clash-of-chefs]{Clash of Chefs} (Introductory Adventure)

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.QGds82qMYwSN4RNW]{The Weary Ogre} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 49, chapter 4)

The Arcane Tower.name: The Arcane Tower
The Arcane Tower.text:
The Arcane Tower, built by Master Arlen the Constructor, and his students, houses the most senior and experienced wizards in the realm and an extensive library on the wizardly arts. Entry to the Arcane Tower is rare and only for arcane spellcasters, though other magic users or sages have been admitted from time to time. The King’s Road ends at the gates of the Tower. The acting archmage of Aglarion, @UUID[Actor.xVL8XxVxvXFJ0I4P]{Master Zaophas}, runs a rigorous, tidy academy.

Adventures at this location:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.GQiLzQUe9UnyId97.JournalEntryPage.eUZhmb3c6SwEXlzf]{The Arcane Tower} (Main quest, chapter 4)

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.i1dStP5OPX8LC9eG]{Arcane Tower, vaults} (Main quest, chapter 4)

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.srYQRMb3qMVreTe4]{Arcane Tower} (Detail descriptionof the location)

  • @UUID[Scene.CJnACCMtgrx0te94]{Arcane Tower} (Map)

Cursed kingdom description:

Post curse, this location becomes the Vaults of the Arcane Tower.

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.XWgsSGOHLhJUnUSg]{Vaults of the Arcane Tower} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 50, chapter 4)

Ulden Lowlands.name: Ulden Lowlands
Ulden Lowlands.text:
These lowlands are very tranquil and relatively empty. Two brick roads wind through, one in the direction of @UUID[.UkUFginTGotvRy13]{Harveston} (location 52), and another, less traveled one, to the @UUID[.yT8p89dbJi2C3wVK]{Arcane Tower} (location 50).

Cursed kingdom description:

Post curse, this location becomas the Fields of Nightmares.

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.qL99ZyaBq1GnJzBu]{Field of Nightmares} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 51, chapter 4)

Harveston.name: Harveston
Harveston.text:
Harveston is less of a village and more of a trading ground. The @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#ulden-plains]{surrounding farmlands} and farmers come here to trade, meet, and manage their affairs. As such, Harveston has a temple to the Eternal Mother, a cattle market, a general market, a huge tavern, multiple blacksmiths, and the Kicking Bull – a festhall that can host over a hundred people at the same time.

The annual Cattle Fest, during which the locals choose the Bull of the Year, is an event of drinking and revelry that many people from @UUID[.tImt9vyi5s3JCalm]{Onadbyr} (location 1) and even the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.YBau4aklzXO4754W#drayl-city-states]{Drayl City-States} come to visit.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.id6OHacQbdt9jyeW]{Harveston} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 52, chapter 4)

  • @UUID[Scene.5fDIT3tVaaspKHGo]{Harveston (chap 4.)} (Map, chapter 4)

Leaning Watch tower.name: Leaning Watch tower
Leaning Watch tower.text:
This region has several active watchtowers built from stone and wood, which are maintained and garrisoned from Southkeep to monitor the southern border. @UUID[Actor.uejB7ETrbzTi7xEp]{lieutenant Nermal Ottington} usually spends more time in these watchtowers than in Southkeep on his border patrols.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.40NwGrx9nFkEBsm2]{Leaning Watch tower} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 53, chapter 4)

Southkeep.name: Southkeep
Southkeep.text:
Southkeep is a garrison overseeing the kingdom’s southern borders, housing a storied light cavalry that patrols the borders. Since the age of King Razmyrel Melkar, the keep has stood as a motte-andbailey built of wood, with a large campsite outside the walls.

The current commander of the keep is Captain Renrik Nuhak, a senior @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.iiOhibBiYRG3FzPK#red-cloak-lawgivers]{Red Cloak Lawgiver}, and well-known military commander. His second-in-command is @UUID[Actor.uejB7ETrbzTi7xEp]{Nermal Ottington}, a competent lieutenant and independent and uncompromising crusader for justice and adventure, who usually leads the patrols on the south border.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.u5YsyZL8lNtrJEbu]{Southkeep} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 54, chapter 4)

Monastery of the Spirited Leaf.name: Monastery of the Spirited Leaf
Monastery of the Spirited Leaf.text:
The Monastery of the Spirited Leaf, home to a score of monks, is devoted to the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.RvZvrek5H1zHmg1M#death]{Redeemer}, the god of life. The large, two-story stone building has welcomed visitors and aided those in need for long centuries.

The monks here also mastered their skills in brewing specialized alcoholic drinks. Their most famous brew is the Spirited Leaf, made out of special herbs that only grow in the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#ulden-lowlands-and-forest]{Ulden Swamps}.

The monks are led by @UUID[Actor.093QcAgTU0qBIcrV]{Tortitudo}, the dwarven abbot master brewer who is the most spirited of them all.

Master Brewer Tortitudo is the only point of contact to @UUID[Actor.nk7VBZeFewplBxEP]{Vaddon} the Hermit, who lives south of the @UUID[.6VvYXPMmWUc34qvg]{Ulden Swamps} (location 58) in his @UUID[.yoSQ5d3mSa2BXQJ5]{abode} (location 59).

In reality, the abbot relies on Vaddon to find newer and newer herbs to process in the brewery and refine the Spirited Leaf.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.j0bBH5JKxMqWLVt8]{Monastery of the Spirited Leaf} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 55, chapter 4)

Azure Bridge.name: Azure Bridge
Azure Bridge.text:
The Azure Bridge is one of the two bridges that cross the @UUID[JournalEntry.mjmyuZYe4n13wv3f.JournalEntryPage.XR33ViQGNkSvrMSt#river-nenock]{River Nenock}. Master Arlen magically constructed it from a strange blue crystal that magically sticks everything to its surface if commanded to do so by the holder of the Azure Bridge control rod.

The current bearer of the rod and tasked with managing the bridge is @UUID[Actor.CriGyudZex6ESzlx]{Klinikk Jordus}, a somewhat ambitious and greedy man who is looking for advancement in the kingdom’s bureaucracy. Small wooden fortifications guard the bridge at its two ends, and everyone but the royals needs to pay the toll to the corrupt bridgemaster.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.T2yr25ji4M6Pbi4L]{Azure Bridge} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 56, chapter 4)

Mud Funnels.name: Mud Funnels
Mud Funnels.text:
This encounter location only appears in Chapter 4 of the adventure when the heavy rains from the Midnight Curse create mud funnels in the Onadbyr plains, infested by ankhegs.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.njx72SC37f7sjVZl]{Mud Funnels} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 57, chapter 4)

Ulden Swamps.name: Ulden Swamps
Ulden Swamps.text:
The Ulden Swamps is an extensive swampland that is unpopulated. It is a thriving natural environment where several special herbs grow that are the basic ingredients to make the unique beer brewed by the monks of the @UUID[.uXhaS5sAMTJvqfnB]{Spirited Leaf monastery} (location 55).

Many dangerous animals and beasts live here, and as a result, there are not many who wander into its depths.

The southern section of the Ulden Swamps is an even more densely overgrown area.

A troll family inhabits th south of the Ulden Swamps. They keep to themselves and usually avoid contact with the outside world. They tend to their domesticated alligators and occasionally trade with @UUID[.yoSQ5d3mSa2BXQJ5]{Vaddon the Hermit} (Kingdom of Aglarion location 59). The head of the family is Kelzar, who hunts with its alligator turtle companion.

The family lives in a massive tree log that floats on the swampy waters.

Cursed kingdom description:

Post curse, this location becomes Kelzar's Log.

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.tcL3AMyGLkhw25H5]{Kelzar's Log} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 58)

Vaddon's Abode.name: Vaddon's Abode
Vaddon's Abode.text:
@UUID[Actor.nk7VBZeFewplBxEP]{Vaddon} the Hermit lives at the edge of the @UUID[.6VvYXPMmWUc34qvg]{Ulden Swamps} (location 58) and makes his home inside a tree hut.

Vaddon can talk to and understand plants better than people and makes his living by collecting unique natural resources and brewing potions and ointments from them. @UUID[Actor.093QcAgTU0qBIcrV]{Tortitudo} of the @UUID[.uXhaS5sAMTJvqfnB]{Spirited Leaf} (location 55) also relies on his expertise to find and bring back new herbs for their brewing process.

Vaddon knows the surrounding areas very well but is hard to talk to - his speech resembles croaking frogs, buzzings of insects, and other sounds of nature.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.KHb1Hg1q0T5CmjiL]{Vaddon's Abode} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 59, chapter 4)

Sobruz Quarry and Penitentiary.name: Sobruz Quarry and Penitentiary
Sobruz Quarry and Penitentiary.text:
The Sobruz Quarry’s clay pits are worked by the convicts of the penitentiary, who are mainly there for more serious crimes.

The hard labor here is considered a more severe punishment than being jailed in the @UUID[JournalEntry.unUwzkbA5fQamYlH.JournalEntryPage.Jx1Y72KiuljK87PO]{Dungeon of Tears} (Onadbyr location 59).

As a result, the guards protecting this penitentiary are unusually vigilant and sometimes outright brutal with the convicts, who are some of the most hardened criminals of the realm.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.fQdrtXH678irZjSM]{Sobruz Quarry and Penitentiary} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 60, chapter 4)

Royal Stud Farm.name: Royal Stud Farm
Royal Stud Farm.text:
This area houses the royal stud farm. The royal groom, Countess Unper Maritayl, lives in a manor house next to the surrounding stables and barns. She is required to take care of the King’s horses, among them, his favorite steed, Blackheart.

Adventures at this location:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.GUVYl3sAqhC1ZZtI.JournalEntryPage.PlwNzSQY7XZfjryr]{Summons at the Old Grinder} (Main quest, chapter 1)

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.Rcnp1R0i2n6xpjU4]{Royal Stud Farm} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 61, chapter 4)

Old Windmills.name: Old Windmills
Old Windmills.text:
There are several old windmills in the center of a collection of large neglected farms. One of the mills is named the old grinder. The farmlands around the mills have long been abandoned after they lost their fertility due to a strange fungal phenomenon known as the rooteater.

Adventure at this location:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.GUVYl3sAqhC1ZZtI.JournalEntryPage.PlwNzSQY7XZfjryr]{Summons at the Old Grinder} (Main quest, chapter 1)

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.NrYftREygG2BRx38]{Old Windmills} (Cursed kingdom of Aglarion location 62, chapter 4)

Ruins of the Royal Summer Palace.name: Ruins of the Royal Summer Palace
Ruins of the Royal Summer Palace.text:
On the high cliffs along the coast lie the ruins of the Royal Summer Residence of Queen Eirammar, grandmother of King Waldrann.

Eirammar built the villa as a place of festivities, and rumor says the villa’s walls have seen many secrets the Royal family might want to keep to themselves. Queen Eirammar was known for gambling and as a sore loser. On one of her bets, it happened that she lost a fortune to a minor noble, Count Plitvar, who had the audacity to request sexual favors in place of payment.

Soon after this unpleasantness, the palace was rumored to be haunted by a fierce spirit, so the Royal Family decided to abandon it.

In fact, the enraged queen had the noble murdered, and his body interred in the walls inside her residence. Afterward, the ghost of Count Plitvar started to wreak havoc. It was very inconvenient for the royal family, so they simply abandoned the villa to stifle any gossip and have not used it since. However, the ghost of Count Pitvar still haunts the ruined halls, mad for vengeance against the treacherous queen.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.7KgJOk4q1ELLv59t]{Ruins of the Royal Summer Palace} (Cursed Kingdom of Aglarion location 63, chapter 4)

Ziggurat of the New Moon.name: Ziggurat of the New Moon
Ziggurat of the New Moon.text:
This is a secret location known to no one. It was constructed around the planetar Morkiel’s crystal of the immortals housed in the Ziggurat of the New Moon and used to imprison the fallen deva Samkiel, by banishing the entire ziggurat to the Astral Plane.

Master Arlen and King Razmyrel Valsyr Melkar found the hidden ziggurat and gleaned long-lost secrets from the mad deva imprisoned within with the highest secrecy. The ziggurat is transposed to the Astral Plane and can only be summoned at its former location, at the highest point of the new moon, and with a specific command phrase. Even then, it remains for the briefest moments before it moves back to the Astral Plane.

This location cannot be discovered by simple exploration. One must know of it's existence, and know how to make it appears, before being able to go there.

Cursed kingdom description:

  • @UUID[JournalEntry.Nq3FpTKjZRMBlD6Z.JournalEntryPage.5R0BkBvPtfv8XmBu]{Ziggurat of the New Moon} (Cursed Kingdom of Aglarion location 64, chapter 4)

Subclasses.name: Subclasses
Subclasses.text:
Subclasses

This collection of 36 subclasses features three for each base class in the Player’s Handbook. Many are woven into notable NPCs and organizations in the Crown of the Oathbreaker adventure, whether they appear on the side of the characters, as neutral players, or as villains. Since many organizations and factions are represented, they can offer integrated hooks into Crown of the Oathbreaker for the players. Players may choose to follow any of them, even ones leaning towards evil or representing evil organizations if the DM allows and can implant into the story without spoiling anything from the adventure’s plot. However, all subclasses can be used in any other adventure as standalone options.

Barbarian: Fear Rager.name: Barbarian: Fear Rager
Barbarian: Fear Rager.text:
Taking advantage of one’s weakness is a crucial tactic in combat. These barbarians learn how to instill fear in their enemies and exploit their opponents’ hesitation when facing a raging menace. The disregard and disdain these barbarians feel for those who fear them gives them an extra surge of power as if they would feed on the fear they create. Many of the Vordani war tribes use this tactic to overcome their foes.

Demoralizing Blow. Starting at 3rd level, you can break the ferocity of those whom you attack. As a bonus action, you can choose a creature that you have dealt damage to with a melee weapon during your turn. If the creature can see or hear you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Charisma modifier) or have disadvantage on its melee attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.

Terrifying Onslaught. Starting at 6th level, you can instill fear in the hearts of those you attack. As a bonus action, you can choose a creature that you have dealt damage to with a melee weapon during your turn. If the creature can see or hear you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Charisma modifier) or become &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened} until the end of your next turn.

Culling the Weak. Starting at 10th level, you can take advantage of those who fear you. You gain advantage on melee attack rolls against &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened} creatures and your melee weapon attacks score a critical hit against them on a roll of 19 or 20.

Intimidating Slaughter. Starting at 14th level, the fear in the eyes of your enemies intensifies your combat prowess. As a bonus action, you can make a melee weapon attack against a frightened creature and your melee weapon attacks score a critical hit against them on a roll of 18, 19 or 20. On a critical hit, all hostile creatures within 30 feet who saw your critical hit must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Charisma modifier) or become &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened} until the end of your next turn.

Barbarian: Frenzied Mutant.name: Barbarian: Frenzied Mutant
Barbarian: Frenzied Mutant.text:
The drow of House Ausstyl keep some of their offspring in an almost feral state, training them to harness their rage in combat. When these children are initiated to the wrath of the otherworldly entities they venerate, they are infused with aberrant flesh that quickly spreads in their bodies like a parasite. These barbaric warriors learn a primitive way to graft their bodies to enhance themselves further with mutations that allow them to grow in power.

Grafted Appendages. Starting at 3rd level, you learn how to graft aberrant appendages into your body and use them to soak up damage from attacks. You gain 10 temporary hit points and +1 bonus to AC while you have these hit points. You regain these temporary hit points after a long rest.

Bone Claw. Starting at 3rd level, sharp, curved bone appendages grows out of both of your forearms that you can use to make attacks. The bone claws have a reach of 5 feet, can be used as part of an unarmed attack, and deal 1d8 + Strength modifier slashing damage on a hit.

Telepathic Terror. Starting at 6th level, you can telepathically project your rage into the mind of your enemies, causing them spasms that shake their will. As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.classfeatures.Item.VoR0SUrNX5EJVPIO]{Rage} feature to assault the mind of a target creature. The target creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Constitution modifier) or become &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed}. A creature charmed this way has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the effect ends on the target.

Aberrant Anatomy. Starting at 10th level, your bodily mutations become so severe and bizarre that your physiology is no longer similar to that of your original race. You become immune to critical hits and diseases. Extra eyes give you advantage on Wisdom (&Reference[perception]) checks that rely on sight, and you gain &Reference[darkvision]{darkvision} to a range of 120 feet. You are also considered an &Reference[aberration]{aberration} type creature for the purposes of determining effects, but you retain your original creature type.

Agile Tentacles. Starting at 14th level, you sprout appendages in the form of two fully functional alien tentacles that spread disease. You gain additional tentacle limbs that you can use to manipulate objects within a reach of 5 feet. You are considered to be proficient with these tentacles when making unarmed attacks with them. You can at-tack with both tentacles as a bonus action. Each hit with a tentacle causes 1d6 points of bludgeoning damage + your Strength modifier. A creature hit by a tentacle must make a Constitution saving throw (DC equals 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Constitution modifier) or become diseased. A creature diseased this way gains disadvantage on its attack rolls and ability checks for 1 minute.

Barbarian: Spelleater.text:

Bard: College of Dirge Singers.name: Bard: College of Dirge Singers
Bard: College of Dirge Singers.text:
The college of dirge singers was formed from the ancient funeral singers of the Inevitable, the god of Death. These pious servants of the clergy of death were able to project the feelings associated with their chosen faith through songs and poems so powerfully that they could influence the emotions of others and even kill them. The followers of the Inevitable still imitate the secret songs and poems of the original dirge singers, but only the most skilled singers can invoke their true magical powers.

Lament of Melancholy. Starting at 3rd level, you can sing a woeful lament that causes creatures to fall into a state of depression. As an action, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration on your turn to choose a number of creatures that you can see within 60 feet equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of one). Those creatures must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell DC or become &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed}. While charmed, the creature has disadvantage on ability checks for one minute but can make a Charisma saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect.

Dirge of Grief. Starting at 3rd level, you can sing a song that causes a creature to fall into a state of intense grief, washing away its hostility. As an action, you can target a creature that you can see within 60 feet. That creature must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell DC or become &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed}. While charmed, the target becomes indifferent about creatures of your choice towards which it is hostile. This indifference ends if the target is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its allies being harmed. The effect ends after one minute and the creature can become hostile again. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Elegy of Hopelessness. Starting at 6th level, you can recite a poem about death and passing that causes creatures to lose their motivation. As an action, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration on your turn to choose a number of creatures that you can see within 60 feet equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one). Those creatures must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell DC or become &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed}. While charmed, the creature has dis-advantage on attack rolls and saving throws for one minute but can make a Charisma saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect.

Threnody of Death. Starting at 14th level, you can sing a song of death that creates harmful necrotic energies. As an action, you can target a creature that you can see within 60 feet. That creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell DC. On a failed save, the creature takes 49 (14d6) necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Bard: High Speaker.name: Bard: High Speaker
Bard: High Speaker.text:
Traditionally, the monarch of the kingdom chooses the High Speaker of the Minaret of the Speaker for lifelong service. The High Speaker’s duty is to study the ancient scripts of the minaret that define its unique magic based on inflections of voice and use this knowledge to serve the kingdom. There are always a handful of apprentices who assist the High Speaker and train in the arts of word-magic. The High Speaker and the apprentices announce important information and call the city to action if needed. In times of war, the High Speaker organizes major movements and commands the Minaret of the Speaker that serves as a magical defense for the city.

Accentuated Tone. Starting at 3rd level, you learn how to add weight to your voice-based spells. As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration to force your target to make a saving throw against your spell with disadvantage if that spell requires your target to hear you.

Commanding Voice. Starting at 3rd level, you learn how to force your will on other crea-tures by the sheer force of your voice. As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration to cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.arzCrMRgcNiQuh43]{Command} spell without expending a spell slot or material components. The command spell is added to the bard spell list when you learn more bard spells of your choice.

Universal Language. Starting at 6th level, you become able to converse with anyone alive or dead. You are constantly under the effect of a @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.gopnZvS0c2jD5FP8]{Tongues} spell and you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.I2LUSF5ogc7Bj62e]{Speak with Dead}, @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.aL1F8fvYLtNzUbKu]{Speak with Animals}, @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.2VXGS206tuChoeXy]{Speak with Plants} spell each a number of times per day equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once) without using spell slots or material components. Your spells that require your target to hear you can affect any creature type that has an Intelligence ability score of 3 or higher even if that creature is immune to being @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.zZaEBrKkr66OWJvD]{charmed} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.oreoyaFKnvZCrgij]{frightened}.

Word of Creation. Starting at 14th level, you learn to voice the word that shaped the world. As a bonus action, you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.T1vpZLam7LezjToj]{Divine Word} spell without using a spell slot or material components. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

Bard: Pretender.name: Bard: Pretender
Bard: Pretender.text:
Not every bard in Aglarion is trained in the College of Minstrels. Some of them learn their trade on the streets by picking up survival techniques that allow them to manipulate their enemies by utilizing techniques of make-believe. A Pretender is a bard who uses talents with words and swords to fool everyone. They are always at home in social situations where they can draw attention to themselves and manipulate people’s choices and viewpoints according to their will. They also excel in com-bat, where they utilize the same tactics of distraction and feint, which they also use when speaking.

Battle Feint. Starting at 3rd level, you can fool your enemies with your sudden swordplay and movement, placing them in a precarious combat situation. As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration on your turn to feint, choosing one creature within 5 feet of you as your target. Your target must succeed on a Wisdom (&Reference[Insight]) skill check against your Charisma (&Reference[Deception]) skill check. If you win the contest, you have advantage on your melee attack rolls against that creature and the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

Captivating Monologue. Starting at 3rd level, if you speak to an audience for at least 1 minute, you can attempt to capti-vate them with your style and colorful phrases. At the end of the performance, choose a number of humanoids within 60 feet of you who watched and listened to all of it, up to a number equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one). Each target must succeed on a [[/save wis dc=@abilities.cha.dc]] saving throw against your spell save DC or be charmed by you. While charmed in this way, the target has disadvantage on all Wisdom (&Reference[Insight]) skill checks against you. This effect ends on the target after 1 hour, if it takes any damage, if you attack it, or if it witnesses you attacking or damaging any of its allies. If a target succeeds on its saving throw, the target has no hint that you tried to charm it. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Elusive Target. Starting at 6th level, you can avoid the melee attacks of your enemies with an unexpected move. As a reaction, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration to negate a melee attack that would otherwise hit you.

The Great Pretender. Starting at 14th level, you can pretend to be someone else by projecting a visage of your pure imagination, while you remain invisible. As an action, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MBMaQLwoy05qzMJ3]{mislead} without using a spell slot or material components.

Cleric: Congregation Domain.name: Cleric: Congregation Domain
Cleric: Congregation Domain.text:
Shepherds of their flocks and great orators, these clerics can heighten the potency of their prayers when others of their faith reinforce them. The congregation’s strength is in numbers, and clerics who follow this domain almost never serve alone and are almost always found in at least pairs. Priests of the congregation can favor war or competence over battle might, but all are dedicated to leading large groups of worshippers, sharing their faith, and lending a hand to their co-religionists.

Communal Prayers. Starting at 1st level, you can make your spells more potent if others cast the same spell as you. When another friendly creature casts the same spell in the same round as you, but before your spell takes effect, creatures targeted by your spell have disadvantage on saving throws against your spell.

Starting at 1st level, you become proficient in the &Reference[Persuasion] skill.Starting at 1st level, you become proficient in the &Reference[Persuasion] skill.

Channel Divinity: Mass Aid. Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to bolster your allies with toughness and resolve. As an action, you present your holy symbol and evoke healing energy that increases the hit point maximums and current hit points by your proficiency bonus x 5 for eight hours for all creatures you choose within 30 feet of you. This trait has no effect on undead or constructs.

Channel Divinity: Heighten Spells. Starting at 6th level, you can heighten your spells more effectively. If you cast a spell at a higher level that allows for additional creatures to be affected by your spell, you can use your Channel Divinity to make your spell affect two additional creatures per spell level instead of just one creature.

Helping Hand. Starting at 8th level, you can aid multiple creatures in the completion of a task or allow a creature to make multiple attacks. When you take the Help action, an additional friendly creature within 5 feet of you gains advantage on the next ability check made to perform the task you are helping with, provided that the check is made before the start of your next turn. Alternatively, you can use your Help action to aid up to two friendly creatures in attacking a creature within 5 feet of you and if your allies attack the target before your next turn, all of their first attack rolls are made with advantage.

Forceful Communal Prayers. Starting at 17th level, you can make spells more potent if you or others cast the same spell in your presence. After you or an ally casts a spell, creatures targeted by the same spell cast by you or an ally gain disadvantage on the saving throw until the end of the turn. Additionally, if the spell requires a dice roll, you or allies can reroll 1s and 2s and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.

Cleric: Darkness Domain.name: Cleric: Darkness Domain
Cleric: Darkness Domain.text:
The clerics of the Darkness Within are secretive individuals who detach themselves from society and keep to the shadows. They accommodate themselves to darkness and operate unseen, focusing on hiding what they deem significant from the eyes of those who seek them. The imprint of the Dark Star’s reign still resonates with the populace of Aglarion, manifesting in the subconscious memory of the society as a whole. Those who follow the Darkness Within keep their faith to themselves even if they are not devoted to the ideology of the dark solar avatar of their dualistic god. They pray at midnight and venerate the new moon as the absolute peak of their god’s power.

Dark Sight. Starting at 1st level, you gain darkvision 60 ft. and magical darkness doesn’t impede your sight. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 60 ft.

Cloak of Darkness. Starting at 1st level, as a bonus action, you can weave shadows around you into a magical cloak that hides your form and protects you from attacks. For 1 minute, creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against you. An attacker is immune to this effect if it doesn’t rely on sight, as with blindsight, or can see through illusions, as with truesight. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Channel Divinity: Darkness Descends. Starting at 2nd level, as an action, you can use your Channel Divinity to harness darkness, summoning darkness and banishing light. As an action, you present your holy symbol and summon a 30 foot radius globe of darkness that functions as the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]{darkness} spell that lasts for 1 minute. The globe appears in a space that you can see within 30 feet of you. Any magical light effect within the globe is dispelled. Additionally, each hostile creature within the globe must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC when the globe of darkness appears. A creature takes necrotic damage equal to 2d6 + your cleric level on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that has total cover from you is unaffected.

Channel Divinity: Conjure Shadows. Starting at 6th level, you can spend two uses of your Channel Divinity as an action to summon living shadows from darkness. This ability functions as a @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.1Drt0SHxbEAHxprN]{conjure animals} spell, however it summons a single @Compendium[dnd5e.monsters.QGcQYZbVl4bWzi4E]{shadow}, which speaks Common and does your bidding for one hour.

Void Eye. Starting at 8th level, you gain blindsight 30 ft. and become immune to the blinded condition.

Shadowform. Starting at 17th level, you can transform yourself into the form of a shadow. You and your possessions become incorporeal for one hour. You gain the following benefits:

  • You can fly at your normal speed.
  • You can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
  • You can take the Hide action as a bonus action while in dim light or darkness.
  • You have advantage on &Reference[ste] check.
  • You gain damage resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder and bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks.
  • You gain damage immunity to poison.
  • You are immune to the exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, and restrained condition.

Once you use this feature you can’t use it until you finish a long rest.

Cleric: Ooze Domain.name: Cleric: Ooze Domain
Cleric: Ooze Domain.text:
Clerics of the Ooze Domain believe in a higher level of physical existence that is represented by oozes. They serve their formless god to learn to be free from physical bounds. They believe that in the end, all organic materials will be wholly absorbed by oozes and are ready to sacrifice even themselves towards the fulfillment of this eventuality. In Aglarion, clerics of the ooze domain usually serve the Blind God, a minor entity that has only a few fanatic believers.
